definition: travel via aircraft, to expose to cool or cold air so as to cool or freshen
details:
noun
- travel via aircraft
= example: travel via aircraft
= synonyms: air travel
- a distinctive but intangible quality surrounding a person or thing
= example: a distinctive but intangible quality surrounding a person or thing
= synonyms: aura, atm, atmosphere
- medium for radio and television broadcasting
= example: medium for radio and television broadcasting
= synonyms: airwave
- a succession of notes forming a distinctive sequence
= example: a succession of notes forming a distinctive sequence
= synonyms: strain, line, tune, melody, melodic line, melodic phrase
- the mass of air surrounding the Earth
= synonyms: atm, atmosphere
- the region above the ground
= example: the region above the ground
- a slight wind (usually refreshing)
= synonyms: breeze, zephyr, gentle wind
- a mixture of gases (especially oxygen) required for breathing
- once thought to be one of four elements composing the universe (Empedocles)
= synonyms: fire, earth, water
verb
- to expose to cool or cold air so as to cool or freshen
= example: to expose to cool or cold air so as to cool or freshen
= synonyms: vent, ventilate, air out
- to expose to warm or heated air, so as to dry
= example: to expose to warm or heated air, so as to dry
- to make public
= example: to make public
= synonyms: bare, publicize, publicise
- to broadcast over the airwaves, as in radio or television
= example: to broadcast over the airwaves, as in radio or television
= synonyms: beam, broadcast, send, transmit
- to be broadcasted
= example: to be broadcasted
- to expose to fresh air
= example: to expose to fresh air
= synonyms: aerate, air out
